entry.title: Redmi K20 Pro won the first in Chinese 618 Shopping Festival

link.title: Redmi K20 Pro won the first in Chinese 618 Shopping Festival

entry.content:
Yesterday was the first day of JD.com 618 Shopping Festival. A number of popular new smartphones, including Redmi K20 Pro, went on sale yesterday. Today, JD announced the ranking of mobile phone sales on June 1. Redmi K20 Pro won the championship of mobile phone sales, as well as the championship of new mobile phone sales, ranking first in the price between 2000 and 3000.

Redmi in the middle and low end of the market share is quite large, then why do you have to do something about flagship smartphone? This is the question that Lu Weibing, vice president of Xiaomi Group and general manager of the Redmi brand, is often asked, especially after the independence of the REDMI brand this year.

On May 28, Redmi officially launched two new flagship products, Redmi K20 and Redmi K20 Pro, while updating the low-end product line to Redmi 7A. So far, Redmi has formed a complete product system of "high-quality and extreme performance" on the smartphone, which has realized the transformation from red rice to Redmi. Redmi forms the layout of the whole product line.

In fact, REDMI set a strategy early on: adhere to the ultimate value for money, adhere to high quality, speed up internationalization, prepare for the high-end market. The Redmi K20 series is REDMI's first performance flagship smartphone. After independence from Xiaomi, the Redmi brand took only 4 months to complete the full product layout from the high quality Volkswagen to the ultimate performance flagship.

entry.title: Realme returned to the Chinese market with the aim of besieging Xiaomi and REDMI

link.title: Realme returned to the Chinese market with the aim of besieging Xiaomi and REDMI

entry.content:
A few days ago, two pictures were circulated on the Internet. Once again, the competition in the Chinese smartphone market is fierce. Among them, Xiaomi has once again become the target of public criticism. One of them is so-called “two vs dozens”. including 10 Chinese mobile phone brands including Huawei, Honor, OPPO, and vivo, and Xiaomi, it seems that Xiaomi is besieged by other Chinese mobile phone brands including Huawei, Honor, OPPO, Realme and ViVO, As for Huawei and Honor, it is quite like a sense of sitting aside and watching the battle. It is said that OPPO returned to the Chinese market with the aim of besieging Redmi and Xiaomi.

Among a crowd of Chinese mobile phone manufacturers, due to Oppo and Vivo's previous success in entertainment marketing and sales channels, so that Oppo and Vivo with a certain sales base, is considered is the most innovative to challenge Huawei.  Last year OPPO Find X and Vivo NEX were thought to be successful to rely on innovation to build high-end handsets and get good sales, but from last year's performance across the Chinese market, the facts are far from as simple as we've seen.

In fact, although the picture appears to be these Chinese mobile phone manufacturers in competition with Xiaomi, but from the current market reality, because Huawei (including Honor) in the Chinese market has been a big lead, Xiaomi has basically made it difficult to pose a substantial threat. As early as last year, Honor has declared that Xiaomi is not an opponent. As for other Chinese mobile phone manufacturers, in addition to Oppo and Vivo, other so-called Xiaomi's Chinese mobile phone manufacturers are nothing more than a bunch of "catch", it is difficult to let Xiaomi bruise, especially with cost-effective play. So all that's left is Oppo and Vivo, and from last year to this year Oppo and Vivo’s performance and changes in the Chinese market, Xiaomi is, in a way, the biggest opponent of Oppo and Vivo now and in the future.

entry.title: Realme officially detached from OPPO, will it be the next oneplus?

link.title: Realme officially detached from OPPO, will it be the next oneplus?

entry.content:
OPPO is on the list of top four Chinese smartphone brands which is called "HMOV" . On May 1, OPPO officially announced the launch of its mobile phone sub-brand, Realme. In India ,Realme share the OPPO production line for manufacturing, and two weeks later launched the brand's first phone--Realme 1.

In less than 3 months, the OPPO, a sub-brand fighting redmi in the Indian market, has achieved remarkable results, with Realme 1 selling 400,000 units and taking a 1% share of India's smartphone market, according to research agency CounterPoint

And almost as much as most mobile phone sub-brands, Realme's fate eventually broke away from the parent company and operated independently.

Li Bingzhong, the former vice president of OPPO and head of OPPO overseas marketing, officially announced on Twitter that he would serve as Realme's CEO and operate the Realme brand, which focus on overseas markets, in the hope of providing young people around the world products with design trends and strong performance.

After the official announcement on Twitter, OPPO CEO Chen Mingyong also forwarded Twitter, and blessed:

Set out with enthusiasm, , bless the brand realme!

At this point, Realme took less than 3 months from birth, to launching the first product, to operating independently from OPPO. According to Phoenix Science and Technology reported that the Realme brand behind the operating company for Shenzhen Realme Mobile Communications Co., Ltd., its registration on June 1, 2018, Li Bingzhong as a corporate company, registered capital of 50 million yuan, by the company of OPPO CEO Chen Mingyong as general manager of Guangdong Ou Jia Communications Technology Co., Ltd. 100% shareholding.

entry.title: Interview with Founder and CEO of Huawei Ren Zhengfei’s in Shenzhen, China, Question 8

link.title: Interview with Founder and CEO of Huawei Ren Zhengfei’s in Shenzhen, China, Question 8

entry.content:
As the most of valuable Chinese Company we can find in China, We pay special attention to Huawei. At Huawei headquarters in Shenzhen，Ren Zhengfei spoke passionately for one hundred and fifty minutes with Chinese media. Valuefinding noted down 62 questions of the interview in English. we also annotated the answer given by Ren Zhengfei. The following is question 8.

Q8 Financial Weekly: After the US export control goes into effect, Huawei's suppliers in Japan, Europe, and Taiwan maybe help Huawei a lot. If this export control won’t wok wel , do you think the US government will put pressure on companies like TSMC? Huawei can design chips, but it does not have the capabilities of the entire value chain. The following is question 8.

Ren Zhengfei: If more companies refuse to succumb to the pressure, then even more will follow. We don't worry too much about this. After all, this is not happening.

Financial Weekly: Considering Google's recent action to Huawei, users in Europe are very worried that Huawei phones will not be able to use the latest Android in the future. What's your opinion on this? How to deal with it?

Ren: Google is a good company – a highly responsible company. They are also trying to persuade the US government to solve this problem. We're now discussing viable solutions or relief program for this, and our experts are still working on this. So I can't give you a detailed or completed answer today.

entry.content:
As the most of valuable Chinese Company we can find in China, We pay special attention to Huawei. At Huawei headquarters in Shenzhen，Ren Zhengfei spoke passionately for one hundred and fifty minutes with Chinese media. Valuefinding noted down 62 questions of the interview in English. we also annotated the answer given by Ren Zhengfei.

Q1 from CCTV: First of all, I am a reporter for live broadcast. You have a military background, you are punctual. I am also punctual. How time flies! Four months ago, we had an interview in this same place. At that time, the public all felt that Huawei had hit its lowest point. Everyone was so concerned about Huawei, and then there are many interviews from domestic and foreign journalists. We didn't expect today's situation to be more complicated, or even tougher, than it was four months ago. Just now, another reporter took out a photo of a bullet-ridden aircraft. I was also given this same photo. It is a photo of the badly damaged fighter aircraft. I heard that you like this photo very much.

Ren Zhengfei: I early saw this photo on the site wukong.com, feeling that the photo of aircraft was quite like the situation of our company. So I sent it to my colleagues. The Carrier BG thought the aircraft in this photo is similar to its situation and started using it for communications inside and outside the company. Later, we found that there were not many major problems with the Carrier BG after analysis, since we have been getting fully prepared over these past more than ten years. So our current situation is that we are repairing our "aircraft" during its flight so that it strive to fly back home.
